intro: Solidago nemoralis var. mollis, commonly known as the soft goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, woodland habitats. The plant produces clusters of small, bright yellow flowers in late summer and early fall. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. It plays an important role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies during the autumn season.
